page.title: 05Poultry Farming
page.content: Poultry Farm The chickens are kept in 6 large sheds each with a floor area of approximately 10,000 square feet. Each shed houses 40,000 birds which arrive from the hatchery in Lincolnshire at one day old.Each batch is either male or female, never mixed. Initially the chicks are confined to the area near food,water and warmth provieded by gas heaters.After two days, when they know the location of these things, they are given the run of the entire shed. The shed is kept at 83 degrees Fahrenheit until the 18th day when it is reduced to 63 degrees Fahrenheit. After 49 days when male birds weigh approximately 4 3/4 pounds and female birds 4 1/4 pounds they are sent to Great Longstone to be killed and processed.
